column4: Hi. I want to ssh in to my machine from another PC. how that can be done?
!ui ssh
!ssh
install ssh-server (sudo apt-get install openssh-server) then type ssh user@host
and how can I be sure that nobody will bruteforce the login?
using a different port
also have a look at fail2ban
thanks :D
just use a good keyword and use another ssh port, then you dont have to be afraid
ok, thanks. any way to test after finishing to see if it will work?
you mean fail2ban?
no. i want to see if tommorow i will login without problems. to test it. now i hav acces only to my pc
ah ok
normally its just working fine without problems
nmap -p 22 ip  from outside
to see if it is blocked /filtered
outiside i use win. and telnet on IP 22 is the same. host unreachable
depending on what you doing of course
normal ubuntu runs ok with 512mb ram

ask microsoft
